messages.content: This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

An office supply company makes two types of printers: color printers and black and white printers. Different sections of the factory with different teams produce each printer. The color printer team can produce at most 20 color printers per day while the black and white printer team can produce at most 30 black and white printers per day. Both teams require use of the same paper tray installing machine and this machine can make at most 35 printers of either type each day. Color printers generate a profit of $200 per printer while black and white printers generate a profit of $70 per printer. How many of each printer should be made to maximize the company's profit?

{"background": "An office supply company makes two types of printers: color printers and black and white printers.", 
"constraints": ["Number of color printers is an integer", "Number of black and white printers is an integer", "Number of color printers is non-negative","Number of black and white printers is non-negative", "The company can make at most MaxColor color printers per day", "The company can make at most MaxBW black and white printers per day", "The company can make at most a total of MaxTotal printers per day"], 
"objective": "Maximize the company's profit, which is ProfitColor per color printer plus ProfitBW per black and white printer.", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Maximum number of color printers that can be produced per day", "symbol": "MaxColor", "value": 20, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum number of black and white printers that can be produced per day", "symbol": "MaxBW", "value": 30, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum number of printers that the paper tray installing machine can equip per day", "symbol": "MaxTotal", "value": 35, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit generated per color printer", "symbol": "ProfitColor", "value": 200, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit generated per black and white printer", "symbol": "ProfitBW", "value": 70, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

An accounting firm has senior accountants earning $3000 per week and junior accountants earning $1000 per week. The contracts with companies to provide accounting services require at least 100 accountants, of whom at least 5 must be senior accountants. To make sure there is enough experience on the accounting team, the number of senior accountants should be at least a third of the number to junior accountants. The firm wants to keep the weekly wage bill below $150000. Formulate an LP to minimize the wage bill.

{"background": "An accounting firm is trying to optimize its weekly wage bill by employing senior and junior accountants to meet their service contract requirements while obeying certain constraints on minimum numbers and ratios of accountants.", 
"constraints": ["Number of senior accountants is a non-negative integer", "Number of junior accountants is a non-negative integer", "Total number of accountants greater than or equal to MinAccountants", "Number of senior accountants greater than or equal to MinSenior", "Number of senior accountants greater than or equal to RatioSeniorJunior times the number of junior accountants", "Total weekly wage bill for senior and junior accountants less than or equal to MaxWageBill"], 
"objective": "Minimize the total weekly wage bill for the firm", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Weekly salary for a senior accountant", "symbol": "WageSenior", "value": 3000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Weekly salary for a junior accountant", "symbol": "WageJunior", "value": 1000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum required number of accountants", "symbol": "MinAccountants", "value": 100, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum required number of senior accountants", "symbol": "MinSenior", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "The ratio of the number of senior accountants to junior accountants", "symbol": "RatioSeniorJunior", "value": 0.33, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum weekly wage bill", "symbol": "MaxWageBill", "value": 150000, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Ben is growing apples and pears on his orchard. He has 50 acres available on which he must grow a minimum of 5 acres of apples and a minimum of 10 acres of pears to meet demands. The profit per apple is $2 and the profit per pear is $4. He prefers to grow more pears than apples but limitations in his workforce allow him to grow at most twice the amount of pears as apples. How many of each fruit should Ben grow in order to maximize his profit? What is that profit?

{"background": "Ben is growing apples and pears on his orchard with TotalAcres acres available.", 
 "constraints": ["Number of apple acres is an integer", "Number of pear acres is an integer", "Number of apple acres is non-negative", "Number of pear acres is non-negative", "Number of apple acres is at least MinApples", "Number of pear acres is at least MinPears", "The number of pear acres is at most MaxPearsToApplesRatio times the number of apple acres", "The sum of apple acres and pear acres does not exceed TotalAcres"], 
"objective": "Ben wants to maximize his profit", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Total acres available for growing fruits",

: "TotalAcres", "value": 50, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum acres of apples that must be grown", "symbol": "MinApples", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum acres of pears that must be grown", "symbol": "MinPears", "value": 10, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per acre of growing apples", "symbol": "ProfitApple", "value": 2, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per acre of growing pears", "symbol": "ProfitPear", "value": 4, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum ratio of pears to apples in growing", "symbol": "MaxPearsToApplesRatio", "value": 2, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A lighting company makes desk-lamps and night-lamps. There is an expected demand of at least 30 desk-lamps and 50 night-lamps each day. However, due to the size of their factory, they can make at most 150 desk-lamps and 180 night-lamps per day. To satisfy a contract, a minimum of 100 lamps must be made each day. If the profit per desk-lamp sold is $5 and the profit per night-lamp sold is $8, how many lamps of each type should be made to maximize profit?

{"background": "A lighting company makes two types of lamps: desk-lamps and night-lamps.", 
"constraints": ["Number of desk-lamps is an integer", "Number of night-lamps is an integer", "Number of desk-lamps is non-negative", "Number of night-lamps is non-negative", "There is a minimum daily production of MinDesk desk-lamps", "There is a minimum daily production of MinNight night-lamps", "There is a maximum daily production of MaxDesk desk-lamps", "There is a maximum daily production of MaxNight night-lamps", "A minimum of MinTotal lamps (desk-lamps and night-lamps combined) must be made each day"], 
"objective": "Maximize the total daily profit from desk-lamps and night-lamps", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Minimum demand of desk-lamps per day", "symbol": "MinDesk", "value": 30, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum demand of night-lamps per day", "symbol": "MinNight", "value": 50, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum production of desk-lamps per day", "symbol": "MaxDesk", "value": 150, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum production of night-lamps per day", "symbol": "MaxNight", "value": 180, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum total production of lamps per day to satisfy contract", "symbol": "MinTotal", "value": 100, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per desk-lamp", "symbol": "ProfitDesk", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per night-lamp", "symbol": "ProfitNight", "value": 8, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Mr. Roberts want to invest in the telecom and healthcare industries. He has $100000 to invest. He has decided that the amount invested in telecom be at least three times as much as the amount invested in healthcare. But the money invested in telecom must be at most $70000. If investments in telecom earn 3% and investments in healthcare earn 1%, how much should Mr. Roberts invest in each to maximize profit?

{"background": "Mr. Roberts wants to invest in two industries: telecom and healthcare.", 
"constraints": ["The investment in telecom must be non-negative", "The investment in healthcare must be non-negative", "The total investment does not exceed TotalInvestment", "The investment in telecom must be at least MinTelecomRatio times the investment in healthcare", "The investment in telecom must not exceed MaxTelecomInvestment"], 
"objective": "Maximize Mr. Roberts' profit from investing in telecom and healthcare", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Total amount of money Mr. Roberts has for investment", "symbol": "TotalInvestment", "value": 100000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum amount that can be invested in telecom", "symbol": "MaxTelecomInvestment", "value": 70000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum ratio of investment in telecom compared to healthcare", "symbol": "MinTelecomRatio", "value": 3, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit rate for the telecom investment", "symbol": "ProfitTelecom", "value": 0.03, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit rate for the healthcare investment", "symbol": "ProfitHealthcare", "value": 0.01, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A farmer has 140 hectares available to grow tomatoes and potatoes. She prefers to plant more tomatoes than potatoes, but the soil and weather conditions allow her to grow at most twice the amount of tomatoes to that of potatoes. In addition, she must grow at least 20 hectares of tomatoes and at least 30 hectares of potatoes to meet community demands. If the profit per hectare of tomatoes is $350 and the profit per hectare of potatoes is $600, how many hectares of each crop should she plant to maximize profit? What is this profit?

{"background": "A farmer has a certain amount of land to allocate to growing tomatoes and potatoes. She has preferences regarding the proportions of each crop and minimum quantities to meet demands, while aiming to maximize profit within the constraints of soil and weather.", 
"constraints": ["A total area of up to TotalArea hectares is available for planting", "The number of hectares allocated to tomatoes must be at least MinTomatoes", "The number of hectares allocated to potatoes must be at least MinPotatoes", "The number of hectares of tomatoes cannot exceed twice the number of hectares of MaxRatioTomatoes in potatoes", "The areas allocated for tomatoes and potatoes are non-negative", "The areas allocated for tomatoes and potatoes are continuous variables (hectares can be fractional)"], 
"objective": "Maximize the profit from planting crops, where profit is calculated by the sum of ProfitTomatoes per hectare for tomatoes and ProfitPotatoes per hectare for potatoes.", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Total area available for tomatoes and potatoes", "symbol": "TotalArea", "value": 140, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum ratio of area of tomatoes to potatoes", "symbol": "MaxRatioTomatoes", "value": 2, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum area required for tomatoes", "symbol": "MinTomatoes", "value": 20, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum area required for potatoes", "symbol": "MinPotatoes", "value": 30, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per hectare of tomatoes", "symbol": "ProfitTomatoes", "value": 350, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per hectare of potatoes", "symbol": "ProfitPotatoes", "value": 600, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A audio company make two types of headphones: wired headphones and wireless headphones. Two different teams make each type of headphones. The wired team can make at most 100 wired headphones per day and the wireless team can make at most 170 wireless headphones per day. Both teams require use of a shared audio testing machine, and this machine can be used to make a maximum of 150 headphones per day. The profit per wired headphone is $50 and the profit per wireless headphone $20. How many of each headphone should be made to maximize profit?

{"background": "A audio company makes two types of headphones: wired headphones and wireless headphones.", 
"constraints": ["Number of wired headphones is an integer", "Number of wireless headphones is an integer", "Number of wired headphones is non-negative", "Number of wireless headphones is non-negative", "The wired team can make at most MaxWired wired headphones per day", "The wireless team can make at most MaxWireless wireless headphones per day", "The audio testing machine can be used for at most MaxTesting headphones per day"], 
"objective": "The company wants to maximize its profit, which is ProfitWired per wired headphone plus ProfitWireless per wireless headphone", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Maximum number of wired headphones that can be produced per day by the wired team", "symbol": "MaxWired", "value": 100, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum number of wireless headphones that can be produced per day by the wireless team", "symbol": "MaxWireless", "value": 170, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum capacity of shared audio testing machine per day", "symbol": "MaxTesting", "value": 150, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per wired headphone", "symbol": "ProfitWired", "value": 50, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per wireless headphone", "symbol": "ProfitWireless", "value": 20, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Jacob has $3000 to invest. He has decided to invest in his favorite clothing company and his favorite tech company. He has decided that the money invested in his favorite clothing company must be at least four times as much as the amount invested in his favorite tech company. He has also limited himself to invest at most $500 in his favorite tech company. If the money invested in his favorite clothing company earns 7% and the money invested in his favorite tech company earns 10%, how much should he invest in each to maximize his profit?

{"background": "Jacob is investing in two companies: a clothing company and a tech company.", 
"constraints": ["Clothing investment must be at least InvestmentRatio times the tech investment", "Tech investment must be non-negative", "Clothing investment must be non-negative", "Jacob can invest at most MaxTechInvestment in the tech company", "Total investment (clothing + tech) must be equal to TotalInvestment"], 
"objective": "Maximize Jacob's total profit from both investments", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Total amount of money available for investment", "symbol": "TotalInvestment", "value": 3000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum investment ratio in the favorite clothing company over the tech company", "symbol": "InvestmentRatio", "value": 4, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum investment in the favorite tech company", "symbol": "MaxTechInvestment", "value": 500, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Annual return rate of the favorite clothing company", "symbol": "ReturnRateClothing", "value": 0.07, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Annual return rate of the favorite tech company", "symbol": "ReturnRateTech", "value": 0.1, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Each month a store owner can spend at most $500 on carrots and cucumbers. A carrot costs the store owner $0.30 and a cucumber costs the store owner $0.50. Each carrot is sold for a profit of $0.75 and each cucumber is sold for a profit of $0.80. The owner estimates that the number of cucumbers sold is at most a third of the number of carrots sold. He also estimates that at least 300 carrots but at most 500 carrots are sold each month. How many of each, carrots and cucumbers, should be sold in order to maximize the profit?

{"background": "A store owner is looking to maximize profit by selling carrots and cucumbers with known costs and profits while adhering to budget constraints.", 
"constraints": ["Number of carrots sold is an integer", "Number of cucumbers sold is an integer", "Number of carrots sold is non-negative", "Number of cucumbers sold is non-negative", "CostCarrot * Number of carrots sold + CostCucumber * Number of cucumbers sold <= Budget", "Number of cucumbers sold <= RatioCucumbersToCarrots * Number of carrots sold", "Number of carrots sold >= MinCarrotsSold", "Number of carrots sold <= MaxCarrotsSold"], 
"objective": "Maximize ProfitCarrot * Number of carrots sold + ProfitCucumber * Number of cucumbers sold", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Monthly budget for carrots and cucumbers", "symbol": "Budget", "value": 500, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Cost per carrot", "symbol": "CostCarrot", "value": 0.3, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Cost per cucumber", "symbol": "CostCucumber", "value": 0.5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per carrot", "symbol": "ProfitCarrot", "value": 0.75, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit per cucumber", "symbol": "ProfitCucumber", "value": 0.8, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Estimated maximum ratio of cucumbers sold to carrots sold", "symbol": "RatioCucumbersToCarrots", "value": 0.33, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum number of carrots sold per month", "symbol": "MinCarrotsSold", "value": 300, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum number of carrots sold per month", "symbol": "MaxCarrotsSold", "value": 500, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A farmer wants to manufacture a special plant nutrition using fertilizers A and B. Each kg of fertilizer A contains 13 units of nitrogen, 5 units of phosphoric acid, 6 units of vitamin A and 5 units of vitamin D. Each kg of fertilizer B contains 8 units of nitrogen, 14 units of phosphoric acid, 6 units of vitamin A and 9 units of vitamin D. To be effective, the plant nutrition requires a minimum 220 units of nitrogen, a minimum of 160 units of phosphoric acid, and no more than 350 units of vitamin A. How many kg of each fertilizer should be used to minimize the amount of vitamin D in the nutrition? What is the minimum amount of vitamin D?

{"background": "A farmer wants to manufacture a special plant nutrition using fertilizers A and B.", 
"constraints": ["Amount of fertilizer A is non-negative", "Amount of fertilizer B is non-negative", "The nutrition requires at least MinNitrogen units of nitrogen", "The nutrition requires at least MinPhosphoric units of phosphoric acid", "The nutrition contains no more than MaxVitaminA units of vitamin A"], 
"objective": "Minimize the amount of vitamin D in the nutrition", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Units of nitrogen per kg of fertilizer A", "symbol": "NitrogenA", "value": 13, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of phosphoric acid per kg of fertilizer A", "symbol": "PhosphoricA", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of vitamin A per kg of fertilizer A", "symbol": "VitaminAA", "value": 6, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of vitamin D per kg of fertilizer A", "symbol": "VitaminDA", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of nitrogen per kg of fertilizer B", "symbol": "NitrogenB", "value": 8, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of phosphoric acid per kg of fertilizer B", "symbol": "PhosphoricB", "value": 14, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of vitamin A per kg of fertilizer B", "symbol": "VitaminAB", "value": 6, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Units of vitamin D per kg of fertilizer B", "symbol": "VitaminDB", "value": 9, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum required units of nitrogen for the plant nutrition", "symbol": "MinNitrogen", "value": 220, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum required units of phosphoric acid for the plant nutrition", "symbol": "MinPhosphoric", "value": 160, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Maximum allowed units of vitamin A for the plant nutrition", "symbol": "MaxVitaminA", "value": 350, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

Mrs. Watson wants to invest in the real-estate market and has a total budget of at most $760000. She has two choices which include condos and detached houses. Each dollar invested in condos yields a $0.50 profit and each dollar invested in detached houses yields a $1 profit. A minimum of 20% of all money invested must be in condos, and at least $20000 must be in detached houses. Formulate an LP that can be used to maximize total profit earned from Mrs. Watson's investment.

{"background": "Mrs. Watson is looking to invest her budget in the real-estate market focusing on two types of properties: condos and detached houses, with specific profits and minimum investment requirements for each.", 
"constraints": ["The total investment in both condos and detached houses must be at most TotalBudget", "The investment in condos must be at least MinPercentCondo of the total investment", "The investment in detached houses must be at least MinInvestHouse", "The investment in condos must be non-negative", "The investment in detached houses must be non-negative"], 
"objective": "Maximize the total profit earned from investments in condos and detached houses", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Total budget for investments", "symbol": "TotalBudget", "value": 760000, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit yield per dollar invested in condos", "symbol": "ProfitCondo", "value": 0.5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit yield per dollar invested in detached houses", "symbol": "ProfitHouse", "value": 1, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum percentage of total investment that must be in condos", "symbol": "MinPercentCondo", "value": 0.2, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Minimum investment in detached houses", "symbol": "MinInvestHouse", "value": 20000, "shape": []}]}
This is an LLM Agent for optimization problems

A breakfast joint makes two different sandwiches: a regular and a special. Both need eggs and bacon. Each regular sandwich requires 2 eggs and 3 slices of bacon. Each special sandwich requires 3 eggs and 5 slices of bacon. The joint has a total of 40 eggs and 70 slices of bacon. It makes a profit of $3 per regular sandwich and a profit of $4 per special sandwich. How many of each sandwich should be made to maximize profit?

{"background": "A breakfast joint makes two different sandwiches: a regular and a special. Both need eggs and bacon.", 
"constraints": ["Number of regular sandwiches is an integer", "Number of special sandwiches is an integer", "Number of regular sandwiches is non-negative", "Number of special sandwiches is non-negative", "Eggs used for regular sandwiches and special sandwiches cannot exceed TotalEggs", "Bacon used for regular sandwiches and special sandwiches cannot exceed TotalBacon"], 
"objective": "Maximize the joint's profit from selling regular and special sandwiches", 
"parameters": [{"definition": "Number of eggs required for a regular sandwich", "symbol": "EggsReg", "value": 2, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Number of eggs required for a special sandwich", "symbol": "EggsSpec", "value": 3, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Number of slices of bacon required for a regular sandwich", "symbol": "BaconReg", "value": 3, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Number of slices of bacon required for a special sandwich", "symbol": "BaconSpec", "value": 5, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Total number of eggs available", "symbol": "TotalEggs", "value": 40, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Total number of slices of bacon available", "symbol": "TotalBacon", "value": 70, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit from selling a regular sandwich", "symbol": "ProfitReg", "value": 3, "shape": []}, {"definition": "Profit from selling a special sandwich", "symbol": "ProfitSpec", "value": 4, "shape": []}]}
